company.name: Erasmus MC University Medical Center - Sophia Children's Hospital

profile_positions.company: Erasmus MC University Medical Center - Sophia Children's Hospital
profile_positions.description: In our research group we combine expertise in biomedical science, molecular genetics,  bioinformatics, data science, medicine, environmental/public health and laboratory practice to unravel complex problems and provide innovative solutions
profile_positions.title: Group leader rare inherited and congenital thoracic anomalies, Group leader ophthalmic oncology

profile_positions.description: Using technologies as Next Generation Sequencing, Copy Number Variation profiling, RNA sequencing, IPSCs we aim at gaining a better understanding of the functioning of our digestive system and elucidating  contributing factors to congenital anomalies of the gastro-intestinal tract
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Clinical Genetics

profile_positions.description:
PhD student working on the research project which aims to elucidate the (epi-) genetic factors responsible for the congenital anomalies esophageal atresia with/without tracheo-esophageal fistula, the VACTERL association and congenital diaphragmatic hernia.
Techniques: twinstudies, SNP array, NGS (whole genome/ exome), MAQ assay/qPCR, sanger sequencing, bioinformatics.
profile_positions.title: PhD student Pediatric Surgery & Clinical Genetics

profile_positions.description:
Researchproject at the department of ophthalmology focused on a further characterization of the involved chromosomal regions in familial and sporadic uveal melanomas with the use of (M-)FISH and SNP array.
Ref: Dr. A de Klein
profile_positions.title: Research Technician

profile_positions.description:
Researchproject in which the influence of vitamin A on the gene expression of genes involved in the pathogenesis of congenital diaphragmatic hernia is studied. For this I have used techniques as cell culture, toxicity studies, SNP and expression array. Sub sequent analysis and data mining are performed with the bioinformatics tools Genome studio, Biodiscovery Nexus CN and Expression, Anni and brb-array tools.
Ref: Dr. A de Klein
profile_positions.title: MSc Internship Environmental Sciences

profile_positions.description:
Research project: Health factors in sustainable and energy saving renovations.

Project leader in a consulting project in which the health aspects of a sustainable and energy conserving renovation of the campus buildings (of the Open University of the Netherlands) are evaluated. Alterations to the renovation plan decreasing health burden and add to the sustainability of the renovation project are discussed with the client (OU, Heerlen) and an extensive advisory report written.
profile_positions.title: BSc Internship Environmental Sciences

profile_positions.description:
Cytogenetic diagnostics (cell culture, karyotyping, FISH, FISH probe development)
Ref: Dr. Pino J. Poddighe
profile_positions.title: Cytogenetic technician

profile_positions.description: In this project protein-protein interactions of MADS – box transcription factors in Petunia hybrida and Arabidopsis thaliana are studied with use of Yeast 2hybrid and FRET (Fluorescence Resonance Energy Transfer)
profile_positions.title: BAS Internship biomedical laboratory Sciences

profile_positions.description: Gynecological and non gynecological  cytological diagnostics, histological and immunohistochemical diagnostics.
profile_positions.title: Vocational education internship
